intro: Maerua hirtella, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a small shrub native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to harsh environments, featuring a deep root system to access water. It produces small, round, spiny fruits that contain seeds. Maerua hirtella is often used in traditional medicine and for soil stabilization in degraded landscapes.
